website_summaries.verdict: Surprisingly well-made, comfortable, and an excellent value for the price, these socks will keep your toes aligned, cozy, and blister-free every step of the way.
pros: Perfect liner socks for preventing blisters and chafing
Available in sizes small through XL
Gray, royal, and burgundy options available

customer_reviews.title: Saved my feet from blisters
customer_reviews.text: I did some 100 degree desert hiking in May of this year and got horrible heel blisters and was worried that I needed to purchase new hiking shoes. After some research, I learned that people with narrow feet are at increased risk for blisters if feet sweat and are allowed to stay wet. I purchased these socks for a return desert hiking trip in July, and although I did not hike as much, it was hotter out and these socks kept me blister free. I wore these under my regular hiking socks. You will notice that the segmented toes do feel a little funny at first, but you quickly stop noticing it. I wish I had purchased these earlier.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Hiking and skiing heaven
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's size 9 shoes (with a 14.5" calf circumference) and purchased a size Medium of these liner socks. They fit perfectly--snug enough to prevent bunching but not so tight that they are restrictive. I purchased these for hiking the Tongariro Crossing, layered underneath a pair of lightweight Smartwool socks. They performed perfectly and prevented my toes from getting squished against each other uncomfortably. I have since worn them when I ski for the same reason, layered under heavier Smartwool socks. Even though the liners aren't knee high like my ski socks, the tops of the Injinji socks do not cut into my calf uncomfortably when squeezed into my boots. I am so happy to have found these!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Riley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent socks for protecting ageing toes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a frequent hiker and developed a painful toe injury where a small toe slipped under my middle toe. My podiatrist recommended Injini toe socks as a solution for many of his patients. He said the toe socks reduce friction between the toes in situations like mine. I bought Injini Liner Crew Socks thinking I would wear them inside regular outer socks. The relief was immediate with the Injini socks and I am hiking regularly again. Over time I discovered that the Injini liner socks without an over-sock work better and are more comfortable. I will buy the Injini socks again and I recommend them to other buyers.
customer_reviews.author: EdB

customer_reviews.title: Tear / hole on bottom after one use. Maybe bad luck but will try next weight up.
customer_reviews.text: I have ised Injinji toesocks and minicrew liners on the past. The mi crew liners are no longer available so I bought a pair of the crew length to try undr other socks for my morning hikes. After 1 walk and laundry cycle the bottom of the left sock had a hole the size of a dime. Maybe I was just unlucky on my first try, but I was hoping for a couple of months use.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Finaddict

customer_reviews.title: and a heavy smart wool sock on all of my long walks
customer_reviews.text: BUY THESE. I backpack and hike long distances with heavy loads, over all kinds of terrain. I use a little "bag balm," these socks, and a heavy smart wool sock on all of my long walks. This may seem like over kill...but if you're planning on walking a long way, with little breaks, at altitude....get these and see if they work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!!!! KNOW WHAT YOUR BUYING!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE LINERS!!!!! I've read some reviews from people who either dont know that or have no clue what sock liners are. I wore the same pair of these under my darn tough hiking socks for about 400 miles of my AT through hike. Not a single blister or hole in either my liners or socks. Now I'm home, I wear them every day at work. I'm on my feet, in boots for 10-18 hours every day. I wear a 13/14 US and I got the Large size.
customer_reviews.author: Jon morris

customer_reviews.title: Go for it! These liners are great!
customer_reviews.text: Ok- these are great! They feel like a second skin- so they do exactly what I want- protect my feet and my weird toes from blisters. I just wish they were not so long - I prefer lower socks especially in the summer months. So to wear these with my normal socks. I roll them down around my ankle. That's the only downside to these guys. I read it's so they don't slip down... But I don't have that problem with my other injinji socks- so... Who knows... Toe socks take a little getting used to- but it is 100% worth it! I will be getting more and taking them on the Camino with me for sure!
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Another win for Injinji
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Injinji socks and have several pair.I live in the sub-tropics and I wanted a thinner pair (I find that Injinji socks run on the thicker side) and these fit the bill. These are perfect to wear with my boots in the winter. They give me a thin layer of comfort, dryness and toe separation that I would not have otherwise. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Candace Lillis

customer_reviews.title: MAD FOR THESE SOCKS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be the liners for my smart goals when I hike and I am absolutely crazy for the socks! The mediums fit my big feet; I wear a size 8 1/2 but I buy a 9 to a 9 1/2 for hiking so I can wear two pairs of socks. These are better than silk liners because they keep your toes separate so you don’t wind up with blisters in between your toes. Coupled with the fact there are no seams, my feet are so happy and comfy that I can kick on a pair of flip flops after a long hike and still wear my socks!
customer_reviews.author: TolaNaomi

customer_reviews.title: function or folly
customer_reviews.text: I just received these socks today, washed them, dried them and put them on. The quality of the sock is outstanding, but I can't help but wonder if the individual toes are more function than novelty, or more novelty than function. I expected them to slide on like a pair of gloves, but instead each toe must be placed into its hold individually. It's really a nuisance putting on the socks, but they seem to be very comfortable once in place. Haven't decided whether or not I'll be keeping them; that will depend on the novelty vs function argument. Excellent quality sock either way.
customer_reviews.author: Unkle Cleo

customer_reviews.title: A bad joke.
customer_reviews.text: Really!? Two left socks!? And no. I can't simply turn one sock over to use on my right foot, because each sock is stitched to fit the heel of your foot. In this case, the heel of my left foot. And apparently, I can't return the socks because of the return policy. This is messed up! A bad joke.
customer_reviews.author: B King

customer_reviews.title: Yep, they're liner socks alright.
customer_reviews.text: Wore these by themselves on a 32 mile hike. Got a hole in one and almost a hole in the other. Suppose I should have used them as liners rather than stand alones. Comfortable and fit well. I really like Injinjis. Been wearing them for nearly a decade. Just make sure you use these a liners.
customer_reviews.author: Vonzo

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return
customer_reviews.text: I received 2 left feet. When I tried to have them returned or replaced they say they cannot be. Awful. Secondly, there was hair all over them which was disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: No more toe blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new Injiji fan! I have a few toes that overlap and even with good fitting, broken-in boots those toes always seem to get blisters while hiking due to the friction of them rubbing against each other! I read a lot about Injiji toe socks being a favorite with hikers so thought I'd give them a try. These socks are really easy to put on and very comfortable. I don't notice them between my toes. The silky fabric helps reduce friction. And, best of all? No blisters on the overlapping toes even with the new boots I'm currently breaking in!
customer_reviews.author: Buttercup

customer_reviews.title: BEST. SOCK. LINERS. EVER
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as sock liners to wear under my hiking socks for a week long backpacking trip. For me, these are a complete game changer. After a week in the mountains, absolutely no blisters, and very happy feet. I've worn them since as regular socks, and they are by far the most comfortable pairs I own. As for durability. These are toe socks. If you try to yank them on, you will eventually RIP them. You have to take the extra 2-3 seconds to make sure your toes go into the right holes. Just think of them like putting gloves on your feet, well, because that's exactly what they are.
customer_reviews.author: 40MM

customer_reviews.title: Great for snowshoe running
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I took up snowshoe running this year, which involved using my Asics running shoes and new Dion snowshoes -- a perfect scenario for frostbitten toes, since I wasn't using boots. I use these toesocks under thick winter socks (usually Carhartt's), and they're very effective at keeping my feet warm. I was snowshoeing yesterday in ~ 20-degree weather for almost 2 hours -- much of it deep snow -- and my feet stayed warm the whole time. They fit well (I wear size 12 shoes); they're a little more trouble to put on than regular socks, but they're worth those extra few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Wright

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I got these in a small and they are uncomfortable for me. I also got a pair of injinji liner socks in a size large and they are awesome and don't irritate my feet. Size matters in these liner socks, so make sure you get the right size. Worn the small ones a handful of times, yet I can't return them as it is past the return time.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Tearing between toes
customer_reviews.text: These are tearing between the last two toes. The material is too thin. And they must lack reinforcement between the toes. I own approximately 40 pairs of toe socks. This is not a normal occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Software Dev

customer_reviews.title: Works well for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid hiker, sometimes long distances, and am always looking for ways to keep my feet as comfortable as possible. I usually wear liner socks anyway, so decided to try these toe socks and found them to be more comfortable than I expected. Their obvious advantage is keeping my toes from rubbing together and getting hot spots, and they work really well for that purpose. No discomfort at all from any seams - once I'm used to then (like 1 minute after putting them on), I forget that I'm wearing them. They are, perhaps, a bit hotter on my feet than my regular liner socks, but that hasn't been a big issue for me - yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great liners!
customer_reviews.text: I may have written a review prior to these. I do repurchase these socks. They are a great liner under my hiking socks and in my winter boots. They are not so much for warmth, but for bunion relief. I can wear my best hiking socks that do not have toe separators over these liners and I can hike for miles pain-free. They are very thin, yet made with good quality, so your other socks will fit over them comfortably. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: JP Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them to train for 40 miles on the Appalachian Trail. I am training in south Florida and the weather is brutally hot. I am wearing them with no socks in my boot and help to keep my feet feeling dry but for longer hikes I would need more cushioning on the balls of my feet. The toes fit really well with no bunching between the toes or extra material without feeling tight. LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Inferior quality/cleaning issues
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality, even though you wash them the dirt marks don’t go away and the fabric forms lumps by the spots where it’s rubbing against the skin and the shoes. I wouldn’t recommend this product...
customer_reviews.author: Wolfi Malik

customer_reviews.title: Blister Prevention Must!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I used these to hike 200 miles of the Camino De Santiago in Spain, and I only got one blister due to a rainy day. I have recommended these to sooo many people. They are super lightweight, and you barely even notice you have them on. They don't feel bulky or odd like most toe socks would. Anyone who is looking for a great sock liner, struggles with blisters, or is looking for that "second-skin" feel, these are for you!
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars. Unless you have baby toes, do not order. Second picture the ruler is laid across the seam of the toe slits, and they don’t stretch much further. I wear a men’s US size 13 shoe and ordered the XL size socks. Toe slits are NOT deep enough to prevent rubbing or blisters between toes. Oh and by the way they are a non returnable item, doesn’t say why and doesn’t show the Amazon policy that says why they’re not. Material seems soft and would probably be comfortable if they were actually usable.
customer_reviews.author: Wes W.

customer_reviews.title: Good design...durable?
customer_reviews.text: Simply said: + Good design and fit (once you have a strategy for putting them on) + Comfortable material + Fits well with FiveFingers Spyridon MR - Worn about 15 times?...already getting holes - Expensive ? If those were more durable I could easily do 4.5 stars but for the money...I can't
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Best liners for backpacking - Philmont
customer_reviews.text: I tried these this summer as liners under my wool socks for a backpacking trip at Philmont Scout Ranch. After a week of wearing these, I switched to a traditional polypro liner (because they were clean) and couldn't stand them. I could feel my moist toes rubbing together and worried about getting blisters. I quickly cleaned and resumed wearing these toe socks and threw away the polypros. I highly, highly recommend these for any backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V Sowers

customer_reviews.title: Game changers!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had found these years ago! I’m plagued with blister prone skin on my feet and especially on longer trips, blisters from my toes rubbing against each other as they are very tightly spaced. These are a bit of a challenge to put on as a result, but they are so comfortable and eliminate all the friction between my toes. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: kd78

customer_reviews.title: A New Experience
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with toe socks.These are actually liner socks and are supposed to go under other socks for hiking ,running,etc.Tried them because I have lichen planus on my toes and plantar hyperhidrosis.So far these seem to have reduced my foot perspiration by at least 80%.It's only been a few days,but so far I am very pleased.I ordered two more pair.They are lightweight so I'm just using them alone in the warm weather.Will be trying some heavier ones when the weather gets colder.Seem strange at first but they are very comfortable and pretty easy to put on.Conventional socks may be a thing of the past for me.
customer_reviews.author: David E Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort!! Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I put these through the test for my first 50 mile ultra. I never broke them in or anything. They held up great and I only had one blister, but I would account that to the shoes and also the environment I was running in (beach sand). I coupled these with another outer smart-wool sock and the combination provided what I needed. I'll be getting another pair. I wish they were a little longer. They are also thin which is great for a base sock, but not sure how long they will last before wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Matt KTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Seem cute, but not that good
customer_reviews.text: I got these to keep my feet warmer under other socks and wick away sweat in winter, but they do a poor job at each. The individual toe thing seems cute, but it doesn't make them warmer, and actually makes them a pain to put on, or turn inside out. I haven't used them for warm days or hiking, so maybe they are good for that. But they are not as warm as other sock liners of similar or lower price on here, and don't seem to wick away sweat.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: Wearing out fast
customer_reviews.text: I love these, very comfortable and helps with blisters. Problem is I got one pair and they already have holes in them, in only one month. I’m not sure how long you’re supposed to last, I’ve been hiking in them (3-5 flat miles) about four days a week, so that would be roughly 16 hikes. Again, I love them but I’m disappointed that they are wearing out so fast.
customer_reviews.author: Shaybly

customer_reviews.title: XL was so small, it only covered half of my toes lenght....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to try out, and thru prime... somehow ok me even though it is a prime item, it isn't returnable... got them in XL, and I'm a size 13... and the toes are soooooo short they dont even cover half of my actual toe, so they are basically useless.... went to return them, but seller doesn't accept returns, so I guess that's $10 thrown out the window... guess some homeless person is about to get a free pair of socks that wont fit them... awsome product.... would recommend to anyone that likes throwing their money in the garbage... and shame on amazon for letting anything be sold with the prime moniker that can't be returned etc...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sterbakov

customer_reviews.title: Absolute life saver
customer_reviews.text: I was quite skeptical about the utility of these socks. I have two feet with different anatomies and therefore always suffered from heel slip and blisters in one of my hiking boots, no matter what brand of boot and insoles I tried. On my recent backpacking trip in July I gave these liner socks a try. Wow, I'm amazed. Even though my heel still slipped, the liner sock prevented any blisters from forming. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M. Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Prevent Blisters
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the expectation that it would prevent blisters as it was advertised. However, after hiking Cucamonga Peak this past Saturday, my heels ended up with blisters. The skin contact was felt by mile 3 and I could tell already that the moisture and rubbing was occurring. Very disappointed... I want to give these another shot. I'm doing another Socal 6-pack hike next weekend. I'll update my review after.
customer_reviews.author: Jpon168

customer_reviews.title: Great for blister prevention on long hikes
customer_reviews.text: These are great for blister prevention as they prevent toes rubbing skin-to-skin. You'll need a nice pair of other socks to go over these (I like Darn Tough). I did the Appalachian Trail in 2019 with these liners and Darn Tough over them and did not have a single blister. Highly recommend a liner sock like this.
customer_reviews.author: W. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and fit!
customer_reviews.text: These are PERFECT! Not too thick or thin. Fit like a glove and work well under my thick wool socks inside my boots for winter sports. I have other Injinji socks (which I also love), but I hadn’t tried their liners. The difference between these and my traditional silk sock liners from REI is an elimination of the dreaded multi-sock-toe-squish, plus these are much less expensive. I wish I’d found these sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: K. McClellan

customer_reviews.title: RUNs extra small
customer_reviews.text: RUNs REALLY SMALL, I normally wear Injinji, size small, but this style is totally different. I tried a Medium in this sock and it was too small as well. The contoured heel works its way to the middle of my foot in a matter of minutes. It's disappointing because I really like the socks, they feel wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Nebtopaz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable And durable.
customer_reviews.text: I have some minor issues with a couple of my toes. I had been wearing toe caps, but they always seemed bulky and didn’t stay in place during long hikes. These socks were the answer for me. I use the light ones as liners inside my hiking boots and the regular weight ones in my tennis shoes for workouts.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Helps prevent toe blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in combination with waterproof socks to help keep my feet clean and dry while trail running to prevent/minimize blisters. The "magic" combination is to a sweat block (or similar product) towelette on my feet the night before, use Injinji liners, and use Blister Shield inside the liners. Then top it off with Dexshell bamboo waterproof socks. The whole combination does a pretty good job wicking sweat away from my feet and has virtually eliminated my recurring blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best liner sock
customer_reviews.text: I used these to go hiking through Colorado as the last time I hiked without liner socks I got maaaajor painful blisters. I had absolutely no problems with these socks! Stepped in a stream so let them air dry over night and they still kept their shape perfectly. These are my favorite brand liner socks, you can't beat the quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tore Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely prevented blisters on long hikes
customer_reviews.text: I would absolutely recommend these socks - they protected my feet during long hikes and prevented my toes from rubbing together. They're comfortable, and I barely noticed them under my thicker merino wool hiking socks and heavy hiking boots. After several weeks of daily use, they're definitely a little visibly worn down, so they won't last forever. But while they do, they are a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Berri

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t recommend these more
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this but after reading some reviews I decided to try them under my wool socks. I used them on a 12 mile 4700’ change hike and had zero hot spots and zero blisters. They are amazing and I will be using something like this going forward. The separate toe slots was a little odd at first but after the first mile I didn’t even notice I had them on.
customer_reviews.author: Longstrider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sock liners.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little bit getting used to toe socks but no friction and no more blisters. I highly recommend these for anyone who walks or runs more than a mile a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worn daily. The best toe socks available.
customer_reviews.text: Injinji toe socks are always the #1 choice for a well made and comfortable toe sock. Originally bought to separate two of my blistered toes from rubbing against each other constantly. I was instantly impressed and hooked on this product. I have tried other less expensive toe socks and in every case returned or thrown them away. Yes they are rather expensive but isn’t the comfort of your feet worth it?
customer_reviews.author: Public Name (required)

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Sock Liner to date
customer_reviews.text: I was resistant to trying a sock liner with toes because I have sensory issues. I have a little toe that is twisting and have become concerned about it developing blisters, so I tried the sock. The toes don't bother me at all, in fact I don't even notice after about half a mile. No blisters so far anywhere on my feet!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: They will help save your feet!
customer_reviews.text: Sock liners are great to prevent blisters in long hikes, wearing new shoes, or when taking up activity after a hiatus. These are excellent. Easy to put on, quick to get used to (toe socks), and perform very well! I recently wore them on a series of 7 14ers and had no issues at all in my feet.
customer_reviews.author: JMK

customer_reviews.title: My feet are in heaven.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go inside my larger socks. They are great! This brand is great! I also just ended up using them just because. I have never ever been disatisfied with an injinji product. They are worth the money!! You won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: JustJen

customer_reviews.title: Camino prep
customer_reviews.text: I used these to help me survive the 500 miles on the Camino de Santiago! I honestly think they were a lifesaver for anyone doing long term thru-hiking. They were a recommendation to me by someone else and they were perfect, think enough to sit comfortably under my wool hiking socks and if I really needed them in a pinch I wore them solo and had no problems. Bonus these dried super fast! The only small problem it that they were taller than my hiking socks but not a huge issue!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than expected
customer_reviews.text: Have been running for over 20 years but started to develop blisters more often in the last year. Several runners recommended these socks. I was hesitant because of the separate toes and how it would feel. Took a bit of getting used to but not too bad. So far I am happy with the purchase. Between 10 to 20 miles no blisters. We will see how they keep up for my longer runs. Would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't imagine hiking without them!
customer_reviews.text: These are a godsend as a hiker and hiking without them is misery. I use Darn Tough socks with Injinji liners to reduce risk of blistering and hot spots. I have never had blisters with these, even when drenched. Truly a must for the long-distance hiker.
customer_reviews.author: j e creek

customer_reviews.title: Never wore before, now I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.text: These socks feel great! Thought it would be weird but forgot about toes within 3 minutes of putting them on. My only thought and I took off a star for durability because the tips of the toes don't appear to have any sort reinforcement. I hope the toes don't poke through anytime soon because they feel great!
customer_reviews.author: boneclub

customer_reviews.title: Great as an inner sock for running
customer_reviews.text: These are working very well as an inner sock for running and walking to reduce the friction and help avoid blisters while running and walking. The knee high sock is just right for me on these very cold (40's) South Texas morning in January.
customer_reviews.author: Oon Suan

customer_reviews.title: Rubs & Causes Hot Spots
customer_reviews.text: These were super uncomfortable for me... They caused pain while I was backpacking/hiking in Big Bend. I had to stop and take them off. Total waste of money for me. :(
customer_reviews.author: maggie13

customer_reviews.title: An Insurance Policy For Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: I have odd toes that tend to overlap each other. On longer hikes they tend to rub against each other resulting in soreness or blisters. The sock ensures that does happen. So far, I've also used HikeGoo in between the toes for further insurance against discomfort. I use these as a liner along with a thicker sock and they have worked well without incident and without my noticing them.
customer_reviews.author: double0salesman

customer_reviews.title: Works, but will not last very long.
customer_reviews.text: The toes on these are smaller then they should be. Overall, the material seems very thin for the cost of the product. After one use the sock seemed stretched out already. The sock does work, but you might only get a few uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable dress sock
customer_reviews.text: I'm a womans shoe size 9-9.5, so I ordered the size M. Pefect fit. At first I was concerned they might not be tall enough to wear as a dress sock for work, but they hit a good 4 inches over my ankle. More importantly they're not too snug around the top of the sock. I'm in love. Can we get some in black , navy blue, and dark charcoal? I wouldn't mind if they were even a bit taller.
customer_reviews.author: Lindley Karstens

customer_reviews.title: Great baselayer for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Love Injinji for running and these are great liners for hiking. Wear them with Apolo backpacking boots for rocky hiking. Can do 18 - 20 hard miles in river beds and no blisters. Wearing ice reaker hikers over these liners. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Newfie Lover

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Cool
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing. I got them for a job where I hike a few miles everyday to prevent my feet from getting blisters and keep them cool. They do both very well, especially the cooling part. I would recommend these from any avid hiker. They are also very comfy to wear just around the house if your feet get hot easily. I have noticed them starting to look a little fuzzy after a couple weeks but overall, 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Katieg

customer_reviews.title: Injiji socks are the best
customer_reviews.text: I am prone to blisters, because my feet get very warm and swell A LOT when I hike or backpack. But when I use these liners, especially with the corresponding sock, no blisters for me. The material is soft and doesn't bunch, despite it going between the toes. This is crucial for foot care when hiking. I will never go back to another sock.
customer_reviews.author: junebuggy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent liner socks
customer_reviews.text: I just completed a 12 day backpacking trek, using these liner socks under Smartwool socks. So glad I did. the individual compartments protected my toes. No blisters! I was very worried about my feet, but these liners saved my from misery. They take just a little more time to but on, but well worth the time and effort. They held up well to 3 or 4 days wear, and could probably be used more before washing, but I had three pair. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Leinad

customer_reviews.title: Never a blister!
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and thin to go under other thicker socks for hiking. I used to always get blisters between my toes and now I can go miles and miles and my feet are perfect. I have 4 pairs of these now!
customer_reviews.author: sunnydog

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, best sock liner out there.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most comfortable, most effective and longest lasting sock liners out there. I bought these in 2015 and have worn these socks every day, all summer long since then and they are still in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Feet saver
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 7.5 shoe/8 hiking boot and bought a size small and they fit great. I have bunions and overlapping toes and these have really helped. I hike 7 miles a day and was using so many foot remedy products it was ridiculous. With these I can stop using them. I do wear another pair of socks over them to add an extra amount of cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the right size.
customer_reviews.text: Advancing in age, I needed something to protect my toes from corns and callouses. Gel sleeves and inserts weren’t working well or very cumbersome to use. I originally found these at REI and they worked pretty well, so I purchased more thru Amazon. They arrived quickly and in proper condition. Also, I have large feet and they fit perfectly under my hiking socks. Will probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G

customer_reviews.title: Through Hiking Long Trail Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I did my first ever through hike this fall. I was terrified that I would get blisters and packed a substantial blister kit. I did not need it at all because these Injinji Liner Toesocks are excellent. No blisters at all. Buy two pairs, you're going to want to wear them forever.
customer_reviews.author: Shari DeCarlo

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as durable as hoped, but feel great
customer_reviews.text: Use on long all-day hikes and feel great as liners underneath Darn Tough socks (both warm and cold days). Really nice in keeping the toes from rubbing on each other. Only problem I have is they already have small holes forming in big toe after only several hikes despite keeping toenails trimmed (though are for 8-10hrs of use each time).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Having been away from backpacking for a number of years, there have been really pleasant surprises in equipment advances. These socks are near the top of my overall 'wow' list. Great product and concept. Have now logged some miles in several pairs of these delightful socks and have been nothing less than comfortable and blister free. Am hiking Colorado trail in summer, and these socks have pretty well eliminated at least one concern that I have about foot comfort and blisters. Great to have found these socks and highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Saved my toes!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect with these socks because I normally don't like anything between my toes, but they were surprisingly comfortable. After a while, I didn't notice them on my feet. I did layer another pair of socks over them during my hikes for added cushioning, but probably could have skipped that. I'm a bit concerned that they are not going to be durable enough for a season of hiking though, as the pinky toe area has some wear already after three long day hikes. Overall, I would recommend them if you have concerns about blisters during hikes.
customer_reviews.author: e. whitsett

customer_reviews.title: or you can slip them on underneath a pair of wool winter socks and your feet will be nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: These socks are exactly what I wanted and more. You can use them for athletic use and it will wick away sweat and aid in keeping your feet dry, or you can slip them on underneath a pair of wool winter socks and your feet will be nice and warm. The toe slots take a bit of getting used too, but with a little time it will take no time. Haha. I highly recommend these socks whether you are wearing vibram five fingers, Tabi shoes< or just regular tennis shoes. Your feet will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: driftmissile

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with the liners. I wear smart wool or darn tough socks with my altra trail runners. Sweat pooling up at forefoot. No longer! I didn't think adding another layer would help but I was Wrong. This is the cat's meow! My feet Love You 😘
customer_reviews.author: Earl Feathers

customer_reviews.title: Great socks to reduce between the toes blisters
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10.5 US and purchased the large, they fit perfectly. I have always had issues of my toes rubbing together and blistering on long hikes 5+ miles. I've used these socks a number of times over the past year on 5-10 mile hikes on flat ground as well as in the Sierras and have not encountered a single blister while wearing these socks. I'm leaving this review right before I order an additional pair. Still have the first pair with no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Since Sliced Bread!
customer_reviews.text: Injinji liner toe socks are the best thing since sliced bread! I didn't have an issue with blisters before using these but I felt as though I had an extra layer of slick protection between my skin and my boots. No pain, no hotspots, no discomfort whatsoever. I'm buying another pair so I can hike in one pair while the other is drying on my pack. The feeling of having my toes in their own cocoons took a little getting used to - felt kind of like butter squished between my toes (don't ask how I know). Anyways, I highly recommend the Injinji toe sock liners to every hiker.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Kept normally damp feet dry!
customer_reviews.text: I loved them. My feet are normally damp after a hike. After 5.5 hours in boots on the trail, my feet were dry! The toes felt strange at first but there was no rubbing. I love them and will order more!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that the toes would be uncomfortable, but they weren't they felt like regular socks. I wore these on a 24 mile rim-to-rim Grand Canyon hike and did not get a single blister!
customer_reviews.author: nien

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight liners. Fit my 12.5 foot very well.
customer_reviews.text: I love Injinji's for hiking. I own 2 liners, one summer weight pair and one winter weight pair. They also work well if you wear sandals with the between the toe piece and don't mind that "look". Take your time getting them on and placing each toe into their corresponding toe "pocket"
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: On the fence
customer_reviews.text: These are good for separating toes, and nice and thin. The drawback is that your feet smell much worse at the end of the day after wearing these, than with regular socks. Perhaps a bamboo blend would work better for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: alyson

customer_reviews.title: you won't be disappointed. I use these as hiking sock liners to ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to get used to the feeling of the sock going inbetween your toes, but after you get used to it, you won't be disappointed. I use these as hiking sock liners to protect my feet. Even with a decent fitting pair of hiking boots, I would regularly get blisters at certain hot spots, but after wearing a pair of hiking socks over these liner socks, I never get blisters anymore! The material also wicks away moisture, and keeps my feet nice and dry. After washing these in a stream, I noticed the material drys pretty fast as well. Very satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Too uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I got blisters between my toes on my last long hike, so I bought these hoping they would prevent blisters. They were too uncomfortable to wear. I wore them under thin Smartwool socks, and they made my toes feel crowded in my hiking boots. I hiked with them for a 9 mile hike, and they were annoying the whole time I hiked. The pinky toes bunched up since they were longer than my toes, and made my pinky toenails feel squished. I constantly noticed the crowded feeling of my toes. I think I got slightly less blisters, but the socks were too annoying to wear again.
customer_reviews.author: bird lover

customer_reviews.title: Great socks, very soft
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality socks and they feel really good on your feet. They were recommended on the YouTube channel named follow Bigfoot, and he was right to recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bius

customer_reviews.title: Nice item, as expected
customer_reviews.text: These are what I expected. I use a different brand, myself, but my son wanted these liners for hiking. He said they were too small, but these things are expected to be tight in order to fit as liners, not socks in his use... they are great socks for toe-shoes and great as liners to limit blisters on toes when running or hiking in regular sneakers/boots.
customer_reviews.author: RH-PA

customer_reviews.title: Like having a splint on every toe
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. They are great when walking or hiking. I have a motor and sensory neuropathy, so my toes are hammered. Plus the seam in normal socks are aggravating and the way they twist is too. These socks fix all of that.
customer_reviews.author: Man What Lives in the Woods

customer_reviews.title: Took a beating and survived
customer_reviews.text: Just recently use these for a 26.2 mile Ruck march ( Baton memorial death march ). These socks were amazing. Used only one pair and never changed them for the whole march. I will caveat that I did mole skin of my feet appropriately the way I need my feet to be. I fully endorse this product and they fot perfect to a size 13.5 mens foot.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money, these are thin, cheap and the toes are about 1/2” long. I ordered a size large and they wouldn’t fit the average 6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Haltom

customer_reviews.title: GREAT sock liners
customer_reviews.text: Wore these as song liners on a recent 50 mile (one day) walk. No blisters or pains of any kind. Would highly recommend these if you need a sock liner for running or long distance walking.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lempp

customer_reviews.title: I’ll be buying more
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I haven’t tried these sooner. Not only are they very comfortable but they made hiking so much more enjoyable. Hot spots that I previously got on my feet did not appear while using these. Much smaller than I was expecting, and they only weigh 1.16 ounces. But worth double that in gold.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Helps correct bunions
customer_reviews.text: I bought my size and a size larger so I can wear three pairs at once. This separates the toes. I have been wearing them about a year now and my bunion pain is reducing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Moore LMT BA

customer_reviews.title: Made in China`
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it is merely coincidence / unlucky, but I noticed a hole in the bottom of one sock the first day i wore them (in the house on carpet). A bit disappointed with that after having great luck running over 12,000 km in 6 pairs of Injinji's I purchased in 2014 and continue to wear. Granted they are a midweight and not a liner, they were also made in the USA and still have zero holes
customer_reviews.author: tim krier

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I thought I’d add these to my merino wool hiking socks & give them a try. For long backpacking trips they’re absolutely wonderful. I’ll probably buy another pair or two so I can wear them more often.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for physical activity, comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these for my through hike on the John Muir Trail (211 miles) and they held up beautifully. I wore then underneath Darn Tough socks and switched them out every day. I love these socks for hiking. I don't have experience with them otherwise, but I know some people use them for running. I imagine they would do the job just fine there as well.
customer_reviews.author: Robin N.

customer_reviews.title: a form fitting glove of a sock liner
customer_reviews.text: very breathable almost feels like they arent on your feet. These paired with the other toe socks fit great and the double layer prevents blisters and helps wick away moisture. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: MDMD

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: Suggest seller lists pics similar to the ones I uploaded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be perfect, but..
customer_reviews.text: These could be perfect... but they make my feet sweat and the band at the top is WAY too tight. I do love how thin they are though.
customer_reviews.author: CrabbyChic70

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Wearability
customer_reviews.text: I used several pair to hike the PCT. They worked very well in conjunction with a pair of Darn Tough 1/4 high hiking socks, however, every pair tore between the little and adjacent toe as well as wore a hole through the ball of the foot very quickly. I had to replace the socks every 300-400 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C.

customer_reviews.title: can’t say anything bad about these socks
customer_reviews.text: Did the Camino de Santiago using these toe socks plus merino ice breaker socks and didn’t get one blister. If you’re going on a Camino type hike for a few weeks, you probably need to buy 6 pairs because after washing a couple of times the pinky toe was starting to get a bit thin and stretched out. Other than that though, can’t say anything bad about these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sock for ALL Activities
customer_reviews.text: Been a fan of this brand for a while. I recommend these guys for just about any activity. Wore them in boots, trail shoes and my runners. If you have toe friction, they are the ticket!
customer_reviews.author: Corb

customer_reviews.title: Pill easily but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Shelf life isn't great on these but I treat them as a tool that prevents blisters on long hikes. They are worth their weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: ap1986

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear these when I ride motorcycle on hot days and these are very comfortable. Have 2 pairs that I wore for 900 miles of riding from NW PA WV for West Virginia Motovlogger Meetup 2019
customer_reviews.author: LAWSONRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I hike nearly daily and my favorite boots are starting to give me blisters on longer hikes. These saved me and work like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect and worked great. Wore a pair of darn tough merino wool socks over these and my feet stayed warm in 20 degree temps even when my boots were soaked. I hiked 70 miles in these socks with a heavy pack and have no blisters or feet problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Helps prevent blisters
customer_reviews.text: These really do help prevent blisters when hiking. If I'm hiking more than 5 miles I'll put them on under my normal hiking socks. They're really comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Redd
